snippet: The service, Patch, has been losing money and has been a frustration for AOL’s chief executive, Tim Armstrong. The company is expected to shed many of its 900 local sites.
abstract: AOL moves to cut losses at its struggling local news service Patch by eliminating as many as 500 positions and closing or consolidating many of its sites nationwide; cuts are part of effort to reach profitability in division that has failed to gain traction with consumers and has suffered huge financial losses.
lead_paragraph: The service, Patch, has been losing money and has been a frustration for AOL’s chief executive, Tim Armstrong. The company is expected to shed many of its 900 local sites.

headline.main: Deep Cuts at Patch, AOL’s Local News Sites
headline.print_headline: Deep Cuts At Patch, AOL’s Local News Sites
